did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: M. E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University at Albany, SUNY

did.abstract: Documentation on Dr. Anna Perkins, a physician from Westerlo, NY noted for her 65 year career caring for residents of the Northern Catskills.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this record group is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this manuscript group were donated to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives by Vincent Cross in September 1999.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Cross was a graduate of the State University of New York at Albany who wrote an unpublished manuscript about Dr. Anna Perkins, a Westerlo, NY doctor noted for her 65 year career caring for residents of the Northern Catskills.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection includes news clippings about Dr. Anna Perkins, a physician in Westerlo in the Hilltowns outside of Albany, New York from the 1920s-1980s collected by Cross, as well as Vincent Cross' manuscript, Tutti: A Novel-Novel, which tells the story of Dr. Perkins. Also included are some personal remininscences by Cross.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is organized chronologically. There are no series.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Vincent Cross Papers, 1986-1993. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as [shortened name]).
